intro: Silene erigens, commonly known as the upright campion, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers are often clustered in racemes. Silene erigens is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
